item.title: Verification of hoax spread in Declaration of Emergency on April 1
item.description: #Introduction On the evening of March 30, 2020, rumors spread that the government would issue an emergency declaration on April 1 and lockdown the city on the next two days. In FIJ (Fact Check Initiative), which promotes the spread of fact check in Japan, this issue is taken as one of the unreliable information. Government announces emergency on April 1st, lockdown on 2nd â€“ spread via LINE, etc. At a press conference that evening, Chief Cabinet Secretary Kan clearly denied the rumor 1.

item.title: Drawing a tree structure with D3.js in Jupyter Notebook
item.description: # Thing you want to do I want to draw tree-structured data beautifully with Jupyter Notebook or a web application! That is my motivation. I use Python because of the convenience of analyzing the original data, and I wanted to repeat analysis and visualization interactively. Python There seem to be various ways to draw a tree structure in Python, and the first thing I can think of is networkxor[graphviz].AlthoughIuseagraphlibrarysuchas(https://graphviz.readthedocs.io/en/stable/), I think that it is difficult to express elaborately because it is a library intended to analyze the graph structure in the first place.
